questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: RubyScore analyses Layer 2 solutions and Ethereum itself and wallets, combining blockchain data with a massive and growing database containing millions of wallet tags. RubyScore solves the problem of inefficient user identification and reward systems in decentralised applications. RubyScore uses a ranking system to accurately track and reward real contributions, reducing the influence of speculators and bots through its proprietary ranking APIs and ranking passport. RubyScore's services include tools to motivate people to contribute to the blockchain ecosystem to increase their reputation, Faucet for testing ETH in Sepolia and Holesy, and a deferred transaction service that allows transactions to be scheduled for a future date and time in available blockchains for multiple wallets at minimal cost.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
- On-Chain Reputation System with SBT: Ensures accurate and tamper-proof tracking of user contributions.
- Advanced Analytics: Analyzes a wide range of parameters to provide a comprehensive evaluation of wallet activities and Layer 2 and Ethereum statistics.
- Deferred Transaction Service: Offers flexibility in transaction processing.
- RubyScore Ranking Passport: A unique identity that tracks wallet progress.
- NFT Rewards System: Incentivizes users with valuable NFT rewards for their contributions.
- Daily Tasks and Referral Program: Encourages continuous engagement and community growth.
- User Profiles: Provides a single place to showcase users' Web 3.0 activities and achievements.

RubyScore targets blockchain organizations that require efficient mechanisms for user recognition and rewards. Our customizable decentralized reputation system meets the needs of diverse blockchain projects looking to enhance user engagement and incentivization strategies

RubyScore stands out with its customizable and decentralized reputation system. By leveraging blockchain technology's transparency and security, we ensure a fair, reliable evaluation of user contributions, unlike traditional reputation systems that often lack such integrity as they are based on determining by behavior patterns rather than a user's actual contribution to the ecosystem

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
What are your plans for further development, and how i will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

Our future plans include creating a dashboard of restacking protocols in Ethereum and Layer 2, integrating new Layer 2 solutions, creating a profile as a single place to showcase a user's actions and achievements in the ecosystem, finalizing the ranking passport and API. The funds will be used to expand the developer staff to focus their efforts on faster and better ranking of Layer 2 solutions and integration of Layer 2 solutions into the RubyScore dashboard, as well as to expand the marketing staff.

questions.query: Email Address
Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Project GitHub Repo
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
RubyScore enhances the OSS ecosystem by providing decentralized reputation analytics, Ethereum and L2 Analytics, cross-chain identity management, and optimized transaction processing.

- Decentralized Reputation & Wallet Analytics – Supports Ethereum and major L2s, helping projects identify real users and prevent bot activity.
- Cross-Chain Identity (Single ID & Registry) – Enables seamless user identification across multiple networks via LayerZero, reducing fragmentation.
- Optimized transactions with the Deferred Transaction Service – Off-Chain ETH Transfers, Scheduled & Bulk Transactions cut gas costs by up to 40%, improving UX and efficiency.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Core Features & Use Cases:

Decentralized Reputation & Wallet Analytics
- Identifies real users vs. bots for fairer airdrops.
- Supports Ethereum and L2s like Linea, Base, Scroll, zkSync, and more.
Cross-Chain Identity (Single ID & Registry)
- Unified user identity across multiple networks via LayerZero.
- Eliminates data duplication and enhances dApp interoperability.
Optimized Transactions & Cost Efficiency
- Off-Chain ETH Transfers – Instant, gas-free transactions.
- Scheduled & Bulk Transactions – Reduces gas costs by up to 40%.
- Multi-Network Transactions – A single interface for seamless asset transfers.
Faucet for Sepolia & Holesky
- Provides testnet ETH for developers and users to test smart contracts and dApps.

How RubyScore is Different?

- More Advanced Than ENS & SBTs – Flexible, reputation-based identity vs. static naming or badges.
- Better Cross-Chain UX – Unlike competitors, Single ID works seamlessly across multiple networks via LayerZero.
- Deferred Transaction Service: Gas Optimization & Off-Chain Transfers – Reduces costs and improves efficiency, unlike traditional wallets.
- Testnet Support – Integrated faucet for Sepolia & Holesky, enhancing developer accessibility

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: Our future plans include the integration of new Layer 2 solutions into our products, enhancing Single ID as a unified place to showcase user actions and achievements within the Ethereum ecosystem and L2s. We also plan to build an API based on Single ID so developers can leverage it. The funds will be used to expand our developer team, enabling them to focus on faster development and mass adoption of RubyScore products.

Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.
How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
RubyScore strengthens Ethereum's infrastructure by addressing key challenges in on-chain identification, reputation, and transaction efficiency.

Decentralized Reputation, Wallet Analysis, and Analytics
- Supporting Ethereum and L2 networks such as Linea, Base, Scroll, zkSync, zkEVM, Manta, Blast, Mantle, Taiko, and opBNB.
- Integrating with Ethereum testnets Sepolia and Holesky, enabling developers to test RubyScore's features in a safe and scalable environment before mainnet deployment.

Deferred Transaction Service
RubyScore offers a flexible transaction management system that enhances UX and reduces costs:

- Off-Chain ETH Transfers – Instant transfers without waiting for confirmations.
- Scheduled Deposits – Pre-planned transactions for seamless financial management.
- Multi-Network Transactions – A unified interface for sending assets across multiple networks.
- Bulk Transfers – Gas-optimized batch transactions, reducing costs by up to 40%.

Single ID & Single ID Registry
- Single ID provides unified user identification across multiple networks via LayerZero.

It enables dApps to recognize and utilize the same user across ecosystems without data duplication, ensuring secure registration and seamless data transfer between networks.

The Single ID Registry is a decentralized database that stores information on Single IDs and their on-chain verification, ensuring compatibility with various Ethereum-based applications and blockchains.

These solutions make Ethereum more user- and developer-friendly, reducing barriers to interaction between dApps and blockchains.

questions.query: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.
questions.explanation:
RubyScore pioneers advanced solutions to enhance interoperability, and user experience in blockchain:

Decentralized Reputation & Cross-Chain Identity

- Single ID & Single ID Registry – a unified user identification system powered by LayerZero, enabling dApps to recognize the same user across multiple networks without data duplication.
- Multi-Network Transaction Optimization
- Off-Chain ETH Transfers – instant transfers without confirmation delays.
- Scheduled & Bulk Transactions – reducing gas costs by up to 40%.
- Interoperability Across Networks – RubyScore streamlines cross-chain operations, allowing seamless movement of assets and identity data between Ethereum, Linea, Base, zkSync, and other L2s.
- Faucet Integration – RubyScore leverages Sepolia and Holesky faucets to facilitate low-cost testing and onboarding for developers and users.

questions.query: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?
questions.explanation:
RubyScore addresses key challenges related to user identification and bot protection in the Ethereum and L2 ecosystem.

- Lack of Reliable On-Chain Identification and Reputation

It is difficult to distinguish real users from bots, leading to manipulation in airdrops, DAOs, and DeFi projects.
RubyScore builds a decentralized reputation system that tracks on-chain activity and user interactions.

- Fragmented Identity Across Blockchains

Users have to manage different accounts across Ethereum, Arbitrum, Optimism, and other networks.
Single ID & Passport Registry allow users to register one identity and use it across all supported networks via LayerZero.

- High Fees and Inefficient Transactions

Unstable and high gas fees make it harder for users and projects to operate efficiently.
RubyScore enables scheduled and batch transactions, as well as Off-Chain ETH Transfers, reducing costs by up to 40%.

- Limited Testing Infrastructure for Developers

Many blockchain projects struggle with affordable and reliable testing environments.
By leveraging Sepolia and Holesky faucets, RubyScore enables cost-effective development and deployment on Ethereum testnets.

- Why Is RubyScore Better Than Existing Solutions?
Flexible Reputation System – deeper on-chain integration compared to SBTs and ENS.
Cross-Chain Identity – unlike other solutions, Single ID works across multiple networks via LayerZero.
Efficient Transactions – lower costs and better UX compared to traditional wallets and gas management services.
Faucet-Enabled Testing – seamless interaction with Sepolia and Holesky for pre-mainnet experimentation.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation: Our future plans include the integration of new Layer 2 solutions into our products, enhancing Single ID as a unified place to showcase user actions and achievements within the Ethereum ecosystem and L2s. We also plan to build an API based on Single ID so developers can leverage it. The funds will be used to expand our developer team, enabling them to focus on faster development and mass adoption of RubyScore products.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?
questions.explanation:
RubyScore enhances decentralization and security in the Ethereum network through innovative solutions in identity, reputation, and transaction management:

Strengthening Decentralized Identity & Reputation

- Single ID & Single ID Registry – a cross-chain identity system powered by LayerZero, providing a decentralized and tamper-proof method for user verification without reliance on centralized databases.
- On-Chain Reputation Verification – users build a non-custodial reputation based on their blockchain activity, reducing fraud and increasing trust in dApps and DeFi.

Enhancing Transaction Security & Efficiency
- Off-Chain ETH Transfers – secure transactions without exposing unnecessary data on-chain, reducing front-running risks.
- Scheduled & Bulk Transactions – optimized gas usage, reducing network congestion and improving stability.

Enabling Trustless Cross-Chain Interoperability

- Seamless Multi-Network Compatibility – RubyScore facilitates secure and trustless movement of assets and identity data across Ethereum, Linea, Base, zkSync, and other L2s, reducing reliance on centralized bridges.
-Testnet Security & Onboarding – By supporting Sepolia and Holesky, RubyScore helps developers build and refine decentralized applications in a secure, low-cost test environment before mainnet deployment.
